summary: Mordecai rises to a position of great power in Persia, second only to the king. He uses his influence for the good of the Jews, promoting peace and justice throughout the empire.

faq.question: What position did Mordecai hold?
faq.answer: He was second in rank to King Xerxes and highly respected.

faq.question: How is Mordecai remembered?
faq.answer: As a protector of the Jews who sought their welfare and spoke up for their interests.
